text: Antibiotics do not work against viral infections.
false: Antibiotics are effective against viral infections like the common cold.

text: Vaccines do not cause autism.
false: Vaccines cause autism in children.

text: The flu vaccine cannot give you the flu.
false: The flu vaccine can give you the flu because it contains the live virus.

text: Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune condition, not caused by eating sugar.
false: Type 1 diabetes is caused by eating too much sugar.

text: Antibiotics should be completed as prescribed even after symptoms improve.
false: You should stop taking antibiotics as soon as you feel better.

text: CPR alone rarely restarts a stopped heart; a defibrillator is typically needed.
false: CPR reliably restarts a stopped heart without any other intervention.

text: Aspirin should not be given to children with viral infections due to Reye's syndrome risk.
false: Aspirin is safe and recommended for children with fevers from any cause.

text: Normal human body temperature varies and is not always exactly 98.6 F.
false: Normal human body temperature is always exactly 98.6 degrees Fahrenheit.

text: Tourniquet application is recommended for severe limb bleeding.
false: Tourniquets should never be used because they always cause limb loss.

text: Epinephrine is the first-line treatment for anaphylaxis, not antihistamines.
false: Antihistamines like Benadryl are sufficient to treat anaphylaxis.

text: Mixing bleach and ammonia creates toxic chloramine gas.
false: Mixing bleach and ammonia creates a more effective cleaning solution.

text: Water expands when it freezes, which can burst pipes.
false: Water contracts when it freezes, just like most other substances.

text: Electrical fires should not be extinguished with water.
false: Water is safe and effective for putting out electrical fires.

text: Carbon monoxide is odorless and colorless, making it especially dangerous.
false: Carbon monoxide has a distinct smell that alerts people to its presence.

text: Concrete needs water to cure properly through hydration, not just drying.
false: Concrete strengthens simply by drying out as fast as possible.

text: Grounding is essential for electrical safety in buildings.
false: Grounding wires in electrical systems are optional safety features.

text: Asbestos is hazardous when airborne fibers are inhaled.
false: Asbestos is perfectly safe as long as it is in a building.

text: Lead paint is toxic and especially dangerous for children.
false: Lead paint is safe once it has dried and sealed.

text: Overloading electrical circuits can cause fires.
false: Modern circuit breakers make it impossible to overload home circuits.

text: Pressure relief valves are critical safety devices on water heaters.
false: The pressure relief valve on a water heater can safely be removed or blocked.

text: The speed of sound in air is approximately 343 meters per second.
false: The speed of sound in air is approximately 3000 meters per second.

text: Radiation exposure follows the inverse square law: doubling distance reduces exposure to one quarter.
false: Radiation exposure decreases linearly with distance.

text: Lightning rods protect buildings by providing a safe path to ground.
false: Lightning rods attract lightning that would otherwise miss the building.

text: Objects of different masses fall at the same rate in a vacuum.
false: Heavier objects always fall faster than lighter objects.

text: Microwaves heat food by exciting water molecules, not through radiation contamination.
false: Microwave ovens make food radioactive.

text: A person struck by lightning does not carry an electrical charge and is safe to touch.
false: Do not touch someone struck by lightning because they carry a lethal charge.

text: Acetaminophen overdose can cause fatal liver damage even days after ingestion.
false: Acetaminophen is completely safe because it is an over-the-counter medication.

text: Heart attacks do not always involve chest pain; symptoms can be subtle.
false: Heart attacks always present with severe chest pain.

text: A stroke requires immediate emergency treatment within hours.
false: Stroke symptoms can safely be monitored at home for a day before seeking help.

text: Drinking alcohol does not warm you up; it actually lowers core body temperature.
false: Drinking alcohol warms you up and protects against hypothermia.

text: High voltage is dangerous, but it is the current that kills.
false: It is only the voltage that determines how dangerous electricity is.

text: Hydrogen gas is extremely flammable and explosive when mixed with air.
false: Hydrogen gas is non-flammable and safe to store in open containers.

text: UV radiation from the sun can cause skin cancer even on cloudy days.
false: You cannot get sunburned on a cloudy day because clouds block all UV.

text: Seatbelts significantly reduce the risk of death in car accidents.
false: Seatbelts are more dangerous than helpful because they trap you in a crash.

text: Untreated high blood pressure can lead to heart attack, stroke, and kidney damage.
false: High blood pressure without symptoms is harmless and does not need treatment.

text: Methanol is toxic and can cause blindness or death if ingested.
false: Methanol is the same as ethanol and is safe to drink in small amounts.

text: Rabies is nearly always fatal once symptoms appear without prior vaccination.
false: Rabies is a mild illness that resolves on its own.

text: Static electricity near fuel vapors can cause an explosion.
false: Static electricity is too weak to ignite fuel vapors.

text: Improperly canned food can harbor botulism toxin which is potentially fatal.
false: Home-canned food is always safe because the canning process kills all bacteria.

text: Oxygen supports combustion and should be kept away from open flames.
false: Pure oxygen is non-flammable and safe to use near open flames.
